TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {8262=PERSONAL/HIGH SCHOOL Four-year letterwinner in baseball and won two letters in soccer for Matignon High School ... Named a baseball Catholic Central League All-Star all four seasons for the Warriors ... Led MHS in batting all four seasons and finished with a career mark over .400 ... Selected Matignon baseball's Most Valuable Player as a freshman and as a senior ... Posted a 7-1 record with a 1.94 earned run average, while striking out 23 and walking just four ... Two-year CCL All-Star as a goalie for the Warriors' soccer squad and named the team's MVP following his senior campaign ... Earned Honor Roll accolades all four years at MHS ... Born October 10, 1990 ... Son of Gordie and Carla Noble ... Majoring in exercise health science and would like to pursue a career in physical therapy ... Enjoys spending time with friends, going to the movies, snowboarding and going to the beach in the summer., 7875=2010 Played in seven games on the season making four pitching appearances while also seeing action in three games in the field ... Started one game on the mound ... Struck out six batters in 11 2/3 innings pitched ... Had a 1.000 fielding percentage in limited action at first base ... In three plate appearances recorded a .333 on-base percentage. , 7492=2011 Stepped on the hill in three games in his sophomore season ... Went a season-best seven innings in the 6-1 win over MIT on April 28 ... Retired a season-high five batters and did not allow a hit in four innings of work on April 21 at Lasell College ... Finished the year with a 2-0 record and a 1.46 ERA, which led the Beacons bullpen., 6955=2012 Transitioned into the infield making 10 appearances and six starts as a backup first baseman and pinch runner … Tallied two hits, one run and one RBI in 11 at-bats … Finished the year hitting .182 with a .333 on-base percentage … Recorded his first career-hit March 12 with a 1-for-2 day and an RBI against Becker College … Finished 1-for-3 with five putouts March 15 against Ripon College … Spent the summer with the Somerville Reds of the Intercity League and the Alabrandies of the Yawkee League.}
